thread.title: North Charleston City 8
thread.title_full: Candidates for North Charleston City Council, District 8 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: North Charleston City 8
text:
Tasha Gandy Tasha Gandy Age: 51
Residence: Park Circle
Occupation: Director of Finance - Spoleto Festival USA
Education: College of Charleston - Bachelor of Arts
 (843) 568-9528, tasha.gandy@gmail.com , www.tashagandy.com
 Gardening, cooking and home projects
 I understand turning a vision into a plan including deadlines, budgets, partnerships, and keeping constituents engaged. I know how to prioritize spending while balancing multi-million dollar budgets.
 Sidewalks and traffic calming in our oldest neighborhoods. Longer term, a comprehensive infrastructure plan addressing public transit, sidewalks, public spaces and the Rivers Avenue corridor.
Bob King Age: 80
Residence: Cameron Terrace
Occupation: North Charleston Municipal Court Judge
Education: The Citadel – BS in Commerce
Political experience: Charleston County Councilman; Register of Mesne Conveynce, Charleston County; North Charleston City Coucilman (16 years)
Contact information: (843) 412-5658, (843) 744-1041, bob1408.king@comcast.net
 Full time City Councilman, family, church
 Experience and knowledge gained as City Councilman for 16 years, and service as City Judge, County Council and RMC has prepared me to professionally meet the expected challenges of a public official.
 Work to resolve traffic problem; improve drainage; create funding for affordable housing.
Marvin Rashad Pendarvis Age: 26
Residence: Park Circle
Occupation: attorney at The Curry Law Firm
Education: University of South Carolina, B.A. political science; J.D.
 (843) 330-2540; www.vote4marvin.com ; voteformarvin@gmail.com
 Family, football and hanging out with friends.
 Experiences and training. Growing up in District 8 allowed me to know the people and issues. I’ve also developed skills as an attorney that are transferable to council.
 Walking the district again and talking with residents about issues most important to them. I want to develop a hit list of objectives for our district.
